project-basis:
Coded in node.js. 
Found a great dice rolling  node module
project-challenges: One challenge was how to let the pitcher say which pitch to throw without letting the batter know. I used the alexa app cards to present the pitches to the pitcher as a random set of numbers for each pitch.  One side effect of this was that now it could also become a single person game. The person plays the batter and can just say "#1" for the pitch and not know what random pitch is coming.
project-future-plans:
Start moving towards a complete game.   Move from the one "at bat" to an "inning" to a nine inning game.
Allow users to pick real MLB pitchers and batters to play
Get real batting vs pitching stats to drive the dice roll modifiers.
Try other sports.
project-purpose: Plays a simple game called "Batter Up" in which a pitcher and batter duel for one at bat.
project-lessons-learned: One proved to myself, based previous skills, that getting a certified skill updated is MUCH easier then getting the certification.  So coming up with a minimum viable product that would still be a useful skill and get it get certified by Amazon early is very helpful.   I came up with a very simple game that only lasts for one simple "at bat"  and  was proven correct again that I was able to get certified in just a few days..
